s84.literal: Granted the title of Marquis for surrendering as a Xiongnu king, 1,550 households.
s84.idiomatic: Enfeoffed as Marquis for surrendering as a Xiongnu king, with 1,550 households.

s85.literal: Enfeoffed on the gengzi day of the eleventh month of the third year of Zhongyuan (148 BCE), died in the sixth year of Jianyuan (135 BCE), left no heir.
s85.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the gengzi day of the eleventh month in the third year of Zhongyuan (148 BCE). Died in the sixth year of Jianyuan (135 BCE) with no successor.

s91.literal: Granted the title of Marquis for surrendering as a Xiongnu king.
s91.idiomatic: Enfeoffed as Marquis for surrendering as a Xiongnu king.

s92.literal: Enfeoffed on the dingchou day of the twelfth month.
s92.idiomatic: Enfeoffed on the dingchou day of the twelfth month.

s98.literal: With the rank of Colonel, attacked the Xiongnu, beheaded and captured more than 700, granted the title of Marquis.
s98.idiomatic: As Colonel, attacked the Xiongnu, taking more than 700 heads and captives, and was granted the title of Marquis.

s99.literal: Enfeoffed in the fifth year of Yuanshuo (124 BCE).
s99.idiomatic: Enfeoffed in the fifth year of Yuanshuo (124 BCE).

s108.literal: With the rank of Colonel, attacked the Xiongnu, captured more than 1,000 heads, with General attacked Nanyue, pacified Longxi, merits granted the title of Marquis.
s108.idiomatic: As Colonel, attacked the Xiongnu and captured over 1,000 heads. As General, attacked Nanyue and pacified Longxi— for these merits was granted the title of Marquis.

s109.literal: Enfeoffed in the sixth year of Yuanshuo (123 BCE).
s109.idiomatic: Enfeoffed in the sixth year of Yuanshuo (123 BCE).

s120.literal: With the rank of General of Light Chariots, attacked the Xiongnu, captured many, merits granted the title of Marquis.
s120.idiomatic: As General of Light Chariots, attacked the Xiongnu and captured many prisoners—for these merits was granted the title of Marquis.

s121.literal: Enfeoffed in the sixth year of Yuanshuo (123 BCE).
s121.idiomatic: Enfeoffed in the sixth year of Yuanshuo (123 BCE).

s130.literal: Went out from Youbeiping as General of Valiant Cavalry, attacked the Xiongnu, achieved merits in Longxi, Anding, Beidi, Shangjun, and Henan, granted the title of Marquis.
s130.idiomatic: As General of Valiant Cavalry, went out from Youbeiping and attacked the Xiongnu, achieving merits in Longxi, Anding, Beidi, Shangjun, and Henan—and was granted the title of Marquis.

s131.literal: Enfeoffed in the sixth year of Yuanshuo (123 BCE).
s131.idiomatic: Enfeoffed in the sixth year of Yuanshuo (123 BCE).

s138.literal: Attacked the Xiongnu as Cavalry Commandant, beheaded and captured more than 2,000, granted the title of Marquis.
s138.idiomatic: As Cavalry Commandant, attacked the Xiongnu and took more than 2,000 heads and captives—for these merits was granted the title of Marquis.

s139.literal: Enfeoffed in the sixth year of Yuanshuo (123 BCE).
s139.idiomatic: Enfeoffed in the sixth year of Yuanshuo (123 BCE).

s148.literal: With the rank of Colonel, attacked the Xiongnu, captured more than 1,500, granted the title of Marquis.
s148.idiomatic: As Colonel, attacked the Xiongnu and captured over 1,500 prisoners—for these merits was granted the title of Marquis.

s149.literal: Enfeoffed in the sixth year of Yuanshuo (123 BCE).
s149.idiomatic: Enfeoffed in the sixth year of Yuanshuo (123 BCE).
